comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: That is Winnie Cutler (left) and Beryl Lamble (from Fort St Girls High School) with Mr Davies, Minister for Education, on Thursday 17 March 1932. See SMH 18/03/1932 p.14 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16848974 .

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: From the SMH of the previous day 17/031932 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16848664 - " BRIDGE CARNIVAL. Goodwill Message Arrives To-day. ... ... ... The message of goodwill from the heart of New South Wales to the citizens of Sydney is scheduled to reach the Education Department at 4.15 o'clock this afternoon ... ... "

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Excellent work! The photo in the paper looks like it was taken at exactly the same moment!

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Nice work! I wonder who those young men are, in the leather coats. 

AB

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] Aha! On the same page as the top link (SMH 18/03/1932 p.14) is another picture showing the guys in leather (or early type of plastic?) coats; they were pupils from Fort Street High School involved in the relay message. Named as F.J. O'Brien and S. Raine (pellethepoet will work out which is which!) - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16848979 . The relay of the Goodwill Message started in Tottenham, NSW and covered 359 miles involving 74 schools. trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16846439 .

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: Tottenham is supposedly at the geometric centre of NSW.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/mich2009] I wonder if that is why Tottenham was chosen as the starting point? Centre of New South Wales One possible definition of the centre for New South Wales is located just off Cockies Road, 33km west-north-west of Tottenham (Tottenham is 110km west of Dubbo). This spot, south of the Fiveways Intersection, is marked by a large sign, constructed for Australia's Bicentennial celebrations. Location: 32° 09' 48" South, 147° 01' 00" East - www.ga.gov.au/education/geoscience-basics/dimensions/cent...
